collect.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to get things of the same type from different places and bring them together
collect.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: After 25 years of collecting recipes, she has compiled them into a cookbook.
The company collects information about consumer trends.
We’ve been out collecting signatures for our petition.
collect.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to get and keep objects of the same type, because you think they are attractive or interesting
collect.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to get money that you are owed
collect.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: The landlady came around once a month to collect the rent.
collect.translation[0].definitions[3].de: to ask people to give you money or goods for an organization that helps people
collect.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: I’m collecting for Children in Need.
collect.translation[0].definitions[4].de: if something collects in a place, or you collect it there, it gradually increases in amount
collect.translation[0].definitions[4].ex: Rain collected in pools on the road.

collect.translation[0].definitions[5].de: to receive something because you have won a race, game etc
collect.translation[0].definitions[5].ex: Redgrave collected his fifth Olympic gold medal in Sydney.
collect.translation[0].definitions[6].de: to come to a particular place in order to take someone or something away
collect.translation[0].definitions[6].ex: Martin’s gone to collect the children from school.
I’ve got to go and collect the book I ordered from the library.
collect.translation[0].definitions[7].de: to come together gradually to form a group of people
collect.translation[0].definitions[7].ex: A crowd was beginning to collect around the scene of the accident.
collect.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: collect
to get things of the same type from different places and bring them together
She collects stamps  (=as a hobby).
They have collected 650 signatures for their petition.
gather
to collect information from different places, or to collect crops, flowers, wood etc, especially from the ground
Computers make it easier to gather information.
The men gathered firewood.
assemble
to collect something such as information in an organized way
When all the evidence is assembled, we will write our report.
build up
to gradually collect more things of the same type over time
He has built up one of the country’s finest collections of art.
accumulate
to gradually get more and more of something such as money, possessions, or knowledge, over time. Accumulate is more formal than build up
He is driven by the desire to accumulate wealth.
amass
to collect a large amount of something such as money, information, or knowledge, over time
Carnegie amassed a fortune in the steel industry.
run up a bill/debt/loss
to allow a debt to increase quickly, especially by spending too much
He ran up huge gambling debts.

collect.translation[3].definitions[0].de: to arrange for cheques to be paid
